description.narrative: Frikom is a leading ice cream, frozen food and frozen pastry producer in Serbia. In 2008, the company acquired Nova Sloga, a former Serbian state-owned mineral water, fruit and vegetable producer. The proposed project is to provide long term financing for the modernization of Frikom, and for the post-privatization investments in Nova Sloga. The project includes the expansion of production capacity in frozen fruits & vegetables, ice-cream and mineral water, investments in storage and retail space, the establishment of fresh fruit and vegetable purchasing, and efficiency improvements.

The proposed Project supports the continued regional growth of an emerging market player, and also develops a local supply chain for small fruit and vegetable farmers: - Private Sector Development: Support privatization, rehabilitation and improve the productivity of formerly state-owned assets; - Employment: Safeguard employment at Nova Sloga, including a large number in rural areas; - Farmer benefits: Strengthen the competitiveness of vegetable supply chain by providing reliable access to market and technical assistance to farmers; - SME development: companies like Frikom (and eventually Nova Sloga after its turnaround) are the local engines of supply chains, upstream supporting farmers by providing a reliable off-take of fruits and vegetables, and downstream by supplying retail and distribution networks; - Community development: the construction of a local supermarket (there is none within a 60 km radius), the local presence of an off-taker for produce with credible infrastructure on the ground, the availability of technical assistance for horticulture will support rural and community development; - Tax-payer benefit: Increase taxes paid and decrease in state support to a loss making state-owned enterprise; - Quality Management Certification: Improve E&S management and quality certification at Frikom, and support introduction of E&S management and certification process at Nova Sloga.
